transcript: the wall, his eyes fixed on a burning candle, and seemed not to listen or even to wish to be thought to listen. Exactly opposite Weyrother, with his glistening wide-open eyes fixed upon him and his mustache twisted up- wards, sat the ruddy Milorddovich in a mili- tary pose, his elbows turned outwards, his hands on his knees, and his shoulders raised. He remained stubbornly silent, gazing at Wey- rother's face, and only turned away his eyes when the Austrian chief of staff finished read-
